title: Album Page, "Lion and Pedestal, Palazzo Vecchio, Florence", November 6, 1887
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, at top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 79.  At bottom right corner, written perpendicular to the orientation of the drawing: 92.  Inscriptions related to the drawings, clockwise from bottom left: fleur de lys; part of wreath; 2 shields and festoon / 3; architrave moulding; cornice; shield; pillars; column; side view / front the same, two pillars at each end / also two shields; Lion and Pedestal / in front of the Palazzo Vecchio / Florence / November 6th 1887.
description: Horizontal sheet cut down from a larger size, with pinholes at the top corners.  Depicted is the statue of a lion seated on a large pedestal seen from the side. The pedestal consists of a thick cornice supported by two inverted pillars (like balusters) at either corner.  In the center is a panel with a fleur-de-lys in a wreath and festoons of ribbons coming out from all four corners of the wreath. Other sketches on the sheet depict various details of the ornament on the pedestal, with inscriptions identifying them (clockwise from top left): cornice, architrave moulding, shield, column, pillars, fleur de lys, part of wreath, shields and festoon.  These are all tinted cream to pale beige, as if to imply marble.  The lion is a soft gray-green, implying either a patinated metal or stone surface.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Lion and Pedestal, Palazzo Vecchio, Florence", November 6, 1887.
November 6, 1887. Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-149.
